channel.title: Eye thing
channel.description:
ok i was getting ready to go to sleep last night when i noticed my pillow would change colors depending which eye was open. to i looked at the pillow and kept switching which eye was looking at it with my hand. I noticed it a couple times b4 but i didnt think it was anything. I tried to take 2 pictures to try to show how each eye sees stuff so here it is.
sorry about how big the pictures are ill have to resize it on a different site. or i could resize it on my phone and reupload it. there is a little bit of a difference in each picture but it is slight. they probably arent that good of examples to show.
I believe it has more to do how each i perceives light. my right eye see white as white; while my left eye sees the same white object as more of a light gray. in the picture my my right eye views the pillow and bed sheets as darker shades of their respective colors while my left eye. im thinking about asking my eye doctor about it.
the images were produced with different exposures. left eye: [img]http://db.tt/8qJT2QsB[/img]
right eye: [img]http://db.tt/Kofvrc2m[/img]

item.title: Eye thing
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Thanks for contacting Dr. David, local ophthalmologist for the Mopar sites. It seems your eyes could need a checkup, so if you could set up an appointment with my secretary sinisoul we can get that fixed ASAP. Thanks for your time.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

This happens to me too, and what ziplock said as well. I always thought this was just some eye problem I hadâ€¦

item.title: Eye thing

item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

This happens to everybody, my left eye is blue and my right eye is red.

Read full topic

item.title: Eye thing
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

If I close my eyes for awhile I find that one eye perceives everything with a shade of blue, and the other one yellow.

Read full topic

item.title: Eye thing
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

I think its not dependent on my eyes now. idk now b/c when i turned my head and compared my eyes again the result was switched. its more like dependent either which side the light source is on or something. the light sources are florescent if that matters.

Read full topic
